basics.name: Ben-orli
basics.label: Data Science | Neuroscience
basics.summary: Here are projects I've been working on. I hope you can find something interesting!

work.name: EdPlace
work.summary: Developed a successful recommendation system for EdPlace (over 100,000 users), leveraging collaborative filtering to match users with suitable worksheets. Improved performance was unanimously agreed upon by stakeholders
highlights: Contributed algorithms and Python code for data cleaning, clustering, feature selection, and the worksheet recommender, which were integrated into deliverables.
Optimised worksheet overlap calculation by identifying pre-computable components and implementing vectorization, resulting in a 120x reduction in processing time.
Utilized AWS and awswrangler to access server data and completed tasks as part of a 6-person team. Maintained the remote GitHub repository.
Received a competitive grant (Â£200) towards the Science to Data Science program.

work.name: Neuromatch Academy
work.summary: Teaching Computational Neuroscience in Python to graduates
highlights: Taught a computational neuroscience course to a diverse group of graduate students and postdocs from computer science, neuroscience, and related fields.
Received exceptional feedback from students for my teaching.
Taught material produced by leaders in the field with sponsors such as Google AI.
Provided feedback on students Python code.

volunteer.summary: Global movement of free coding clubs for young people.

publications.name: Video compression for 3d media
publications.summary: Innovative middle-out compression algorithm that changes the way we store data.

references.name: Erlich Bachman
references.reference: It is my pleasure to recommend Richard, his performance working as a consultant for Main St. Company proved that he will be a valuable addition to any company.

projects.name: Miss Direction
projects.description: A mapping engine that misguides you
highlights: Built by all women team of newbie programmers
Using modern technologies such as GoogleMaps, Chrome Extension and Javascript
